meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's that time again when I, the groggiest game reviewer out there, dive into the world of Men of War II. Now, I know what you're thinking: another RTS game set in WWII? Been there, done that. But trust me, folks, this one's got some bite.

Let's start with the critics, shall we? SpazioGames gives it a 77, praising its deep gameplay but bemoaning its UI and lack of guidance for new players. COGconnected sees it as a worthy sequel for fans of the original, but warns that casual RPG players might feel overwhelmed. God is a Geek agrees, calling it "deeply strategic" and intense. Meanwhile, 3DJuegos recommends it without specifying a score (tbd, get it?), saying it's a challenge for those who enjoy RTS games set in WWII.

PC Gamer gives it a 74, stating that it's a flawed but rewarding gem for masochistic RTS fans. Cubed3 is more critical, citing clunky controls and complicated gameplay as well as the need for an internet connection even for single-player modes. GameSpew gives it a 70, praising its realism, depth, and freedom to explore strategies while complaining about the always-online requirement.

Now that we've got the critics out of the way, let's talk gameplay! Men of War II is all about strategy, folks. You'll need to manage your resources, build units, and execute complex maneuvers to come out on top. It's not just a game – it's an exercise in planning, execution, and adaptation.

But here's the thing: this game isn't for everyone. If you're new to RTS games or prefer a more casual experience, you might find yourself overwhelmed by the complexity of Men of War II. On the other hand, if you're looking for a challenge that'll keep you up all night (or in my case, until my cat decides it's time for me to feed her), this game is for you.

So, what do I think? Well, as a groggy reviewer, I'm always up for a good challenge. Men of War II has its flaws, but it also has depth and realism that'll keep me coming back for more. Just don't expect me to finish the tutorial anytime soon – my attention span is shorter than a goldfish's memory!

That's all for this review, folks! If you're a fan of RTS games or just looking for something new to try, Men of War II might be the perfect game for you. And who knows? You might even see me streaming it on Twitch (just don't expect me to play it during peak hours – I have a cat to feed, remember?). Happy gaming!
